Yijing of Dajianfusi Temple in Jingzhao, Tang Dynasty. Shi Yijing, whose name was Wenming, was from a Zhang family in Fan Yang.

When he was fifteen years old, he already had the aspiration to travel to the Western Regions, admiring the noble conduct of Faxian and the lofty style of Xuanzang.
Moreover, he never wasted time, and his hands never left his books. At the age of coming of age, he became even more determined.
In the second year of Xianheng, when he was thirty-seven years old, he finally set out.
When he first arrived in Panyu, he found several dozen like-minded people, but when they were about to board the ship, the others all gave up.

Biography of Vajrabodhi of Guangfu Temple in Luoyang of Tang Dynasty Biography of Vajrabodhi of Guangfu Temple in Luoyang of Tang Dynasty. Shi Vajrabodhi, a monk from India, was called Jin'gangzhi in Chinese.

At the age of sixteen, he was enlightened to the Buddhist principles. He did not enjoy studying the treatises of the Nirgrantha Jains, so he shaved his head and became a monk. This was the power of his past cultivation.
Later, he followed his teacher to Nalanda Monastery in Central India to study sutras, Abhidharma, and other texts.
